page.title: 05Ulverston Cattle Market
page.content: Ulverston cattle market was first sited in Lightburn Road in 1877. In 1962 it moved to North Lonsdale Terrace. The cattle market is held every{Thursday}and many farmers come from the outlying areas to buy and sell cattle,sheep and pigs. There are 3 auctioneers and 3 selling rings. Auctioneering begins at 10.30 am. The cattle market has made Ulverston a{busy market town.}Many butchers come to the cattle market to collect meat from the slaughter house nearby. There are also farming supply shops and banks surrounding the market. Many people go into town before and after they have been to market to visit the shops,market stalls and public houses. Many also go to other markets,not just Ulverston,some travelling distances of up to 60 miles.
